paper_abstract: We consider the dynamic vertical ray shooting problem against horizontal disjoint segments, that is, the task of maintaining a dynamic set S of n nonintersecting horizontal line segments in the plane under a query that reports the first segment in S intersecting a vertical ray from a query point. We develop a linear-size structure that supports queries, insertions, and deletion in O(log n) worst-case time. Our structure works in the comparison model on a random access machine.
paper_title: Optimal Dynamic Vertical Ray Shooting in Rectilinear Planar Subdivisions
